members.name: Mason Erickson
abilities: Short-burst power surges for melee strikes
members.bio: Mason "Might" Erickson is one of the founding pillars of the Legionaires. As a college-era friend who stepped into the chaos of the Prime Universe, he naturally took point on the ground, becoming a frontline captain who protects both civilians and fellow heroes.
history: Joined the Legionaires during the college era as one of the first official members
Helped coordinate early evacuations when Maw activity began to spike near civilian zones
Served as the primary frontline defender in several joint operations with other Parliament-aligned teams
Recognized informally as the Legionaires' 'big brother' figure, especially for younger or newer members
members.notes: Often leads missions when Will or other faction leaders are occupied. Widely trusted with command in the field.

members.name: Davis Clark
abilities: Direct neural interface with arcane-tech systems
Real-time battlefield data processing and HUD projection
Secure comms routing and network shielding
members.bio: Davis "Cyberman" Clark is the Legionaires' systems backbone. While others charge into the fight, he keeps the lights on, the channels clear, and the enemy firewalls screaming. His specialty is bridging normal tech with the strange arcane-tech infrastructure of the Parliament.
history: Helped design and stabilize the Legionaires' comms and data systems
Provided overwatch and remote hacking support during early Titans and Spartans operations
Instrumental in detecting and isolating corrupted data traces linked to Maw interference
Frequently coordinates with other tech-based allies across Prime Universe factions
members.notes: Prefers to operate from a command center but can deploy with a compact field rig when needed.

members.name: Mckain Bailey
abilities: Barrier generation tied to personal vows and promises
Reinforced kinetic shielding around allies in danger
Heightened focus and tactical calm under pressure
Support fields that strengthen nearby teammates’ resilience
members.bio: Mckain "Vowline" Bailey turns commitment into power. Every promise he makes becomes another line of defense between his friends and the void. As a core member of the Alumni leadership, he specializes in holding ground and keeping people safe when everything else is falling apart.
history: Joined the Legionaires alongside Mason and Davis, forming the Alumni leadership core
Served as a defensive anchor during multiple evacuations and containment missions
Frequently positioned at choke points or fallback lines to stall enemy advances
Known for taking vows to protect specific individuals or locations, then backing those vows with unbreakable defense
members.notes: His shields grow stronger the more personally invested he is in the people he’s defending.

members.name: Kemerey
abilities: Warm healing radiance that calms emotional distress
Short-range bursts of radiant energy effective against corrupted entities
Empathic resonance that stabilizes ally morale
members.bio: Kemerey "Seraphine" embodies the heart of the Fellowship circle. Her calming radiance and protective nature make her one of the Legionaires' most emotionally stabilizing members, supporting allies during both crises and recovery.
history: Became an early emotional pillar for multiple Legionaires members
Supported the team through multiple personal and spiritual crises
Frequently leads non-combat support missions involving displaced civilians
members.notes: Her energy signature is uniquely gentle, making her indispensable for morale-critical operations.

members.name: Sheryl
abilities: Pattern recognition and enhanced tactical intuition
Projected strategic overlays for allies during missions
Limited precognitive insight based on emotional and situational cues
High-stability mental focus that resists panic or confusion
members.bio: Sheryl "Sage" is the quiet thinker of the Fellowship. Not a frontline fighter, but a steady hand who sees subtle threats, emotional fractures, and strategic opportunities long before others do.
history: Consulted on early Legion deployment patterns and mission safety
Intervened in several internal disputes to prevent team breakdowns
Advised multiple cross-faction operations through the Parliament
members.notes: Her calm voice during crisis scenarios is treated as a tactical asset.

members.name: Krystel
abilities: Illusion projection by refracting light fields
Flashburst techniques for temporary crowd control
members.bio: Krystel "Prism" bends light into protection, deception, and clarity. Her shifting, crystalline armor reflects both her adaptability and her role as an emotional and tactical shield for the Fellowship.
history: Assisted in concealing evacuation pathways during several crises
Provided stealth support with illusion veils
Integral in coordinating rapid relocations during emergencies
members.notes: Her armor’s rainbow sheen changes with her emotional intensity.

members.name: Deb
abilities: Rapid information synthesis and archival recall
Access to multiple comm-net channels simultaneously
members.bio: Deb "Oracle" is the knowledge engine of the Fellowship. She gathers, deciphers, and distributes critical information that keeps the Legion operating with clarity and precision.
history: Identified early patterns linking Maw disturbances to rising cosmic events
Developed intel bridges between multiple Parliament-aligned factions
Supports field teams with remote analysis during operations
members.notes: Prefers analysis over action, but her intel changes the outcomes of missions.

members.name: Emma (BYU)
abilities: Aura that boosts determination in nearby allies
Mental clarity projection that helps stabilize chaotic thought patterns
Emotional encouragement fields during group operations
members.bio: Emma "Strive" is a quiet but resilient force who strengthens the hearts of those around her. Her abilities push allies past exhaustion and doubt, helping them reach their fullest effort.
history: Supported Legionaires during prolonged missions where morale wavered
Helped stabilize several emotionally overwhelmed members
Often assigned to operations requiring long endurance or emotional resilience
members.notes: Not flashy, but her presence changes the atmosphere of every mission.

members.name: Jessica (BYU)
abilities: Emotional grounding that stabilizes distressed allies
Encouragement field reducing panic and fear
Low-level healing support for stress-related fatigue
Aura that strengthens trust and team unity
members.bio: Jessica "Hopestead" is the emotional anchor of the Fellowship. When teams fracture under stress, she pulls them back to center with warmth, reassurance, and gentle strength.
history: Served as emotional mediator during internal Legion conflict moments
Assisted in recovery after several traumatic missions
Frequently present during post-mission cooldowns
members.notes: Her strength is quiet, but unshakably powerful.

members.name: Victoria
abilities: Field blossoms that relax tension and anxiety
Light plant-based constructs for cover or mobility
Environmental harmonization to reduce corruption effects
members.bio: Victoria "Sari Bloom" brings color, calm, and gentle power to the Legionaires. Her plant-like energy constructs soothe allies and hinder corrupted foes.
history: Helped stabilize corruption-heavy areas with environmental cleansing fields
Provided cover constructs for evac teams during several crisis missions
members.notes: Her armor aesthetics resemble a mix of flower petals and soft energy weaving.

members.name: Mika
abilities: Soft light projection to guide allies in darkness
Low-intensity barrier fields for basic protection
Morale-boosting presence that helps calm fear
members.bio: Mika "Beacon" is a gentle guiding presence for the Young Womens group, offering steady support when others feel lost or overwhelmed.
history: Joined the Legionaires as part of the Young Womens circle
Frequently assigned to support roles during small-scale operations
Known for keeping spirits up when missions get tense
members.notes: Her armor glow is soft and warm rather than blinding or aggressive.

members.name: Malia
abilities: Emotional grounding aura that reduces panic
Creates small safe zones where allies can regroup
members.bio: Malia "Harbor" is a safe place in human form. When everything feels like it’s sinking, she becomes the stable shore others cling to.
history: Provided emotional support during early Legion training and bonding
Helps younger or less-experienced members process difficult missions
Often present during debriefs and cooldown time after operations
members.notes: Her power focuses more on mental and emotional safety than raw combat.

members.name: Jami
abilities: Enhanced reflexes for catching or pulling allies out of danger
Basic first-aid and stabilizing tech in her suit
members.bio: Jami "Lifeline" is the one who always reaches out first—literally. She’s quick to grab, pull, and steady anyone who’s about to fall, physically or emotionally.
history: Known for stepping in fast when teammates freeze or hesitate
Assisted in multiple near-accident situations during training and missions
Became an unofficial first-response point in small ops
members.notes: Her instincts lean toward saving people first, fighting second.

members.name: Cami
abilities: Aura that lifts mood and restores hope
Light flare bursts to disrupt minor threats
Resistant to despair-based or fear-based effects
members.bio: Cami "Everbright" is the team’s burst of sunshine. She doesn’t ignore darkness—she just refuses to let it win.
history: Helped keep the Young Womens circle bonded through hard personal seasons
Frequently requested for missions where morale is likely to dip
Known for turning even heavy moments into something survivable
members.notes: Her suit is visually softer but symbolically very strong—meant to remind others there’s still light ahead.

members.name: Kanani
abilities: Calming presence rooted in kindness and respect
Gentle energy fields that promote unity and empathy
Subtle spiritual resonance that helps people feel seen and valued
members.bio: Kanani "Alohaheart" brings warmth, culture, and deep kindness into the Legionaires. She reminds the team what they’re fighting for—not just survival, but connection.
history: Served as a bridge-builder between different friend groups and circles
Helped defuse interpersonal tension more than once with empathy and respect
Often invited into spaces where reconciliation or soft leadership is needed
members.notes: Her presence often shifts the emotional temperature of a room all by itself.

members.name: Kenndedy Carman
members.bio: Kenndedy Carman is one of the familiar faces in the High School circle, remembered more for her presence than for combat.
history: Attended school alongside multiple Legionaires members
Provided emotional support during stressful school years
members.notes: Non-powered ally who helps keep things normal.

members.name: Jack Clark
members.bio: Jack "Blaze" Clark channels raw fire with surprising discipline. He became one of the High School era’s most recognizable frontliners.
history: Joined the Legionaires during the High School phase
Used controlled fire to shield civilians from Maw-related threats
Helped train others in hazardous-environment operations
members.notes: Jokes a lot, but switches to deadly serious the second someone’s in danger.

members.name: Emma Bronson
members.bio: Emma "Synergy" Bronson quietly turns a good team into a great one. Her power boosts others rather than herself, which fits her personality perfectly.
history: Joined Legionaires operations as a core High School member
Helped keep multiple teams from fracturing under pressure
Regularly deployed when different factions needed to work together
members.notes: Her presence alone raises everyone’s game.

members.name: Ella Duce
members.bio: Ella "Big Sister" Duce is the protector archetype of the High School crew, always stepping between danger and the people she cares about.
history: Became known for intercepting attacks aimed at less-experienced members
Helped calm and protect non-powered friends during crises
Frequently volunteered for frontline evacuation duty
members.notes: She makes people feel safe just by standing next to them.

members.name: Addison Morris
abilities: Builds momentum for massively boosted strikes
members.bio: Addison "Legend" Morris fights like every moment might become a story retold later. Once he gets moving, stopping him is nearly impossible.
history: Known for clutch comebacks once momentum swings in his favor
Helped break enemy lines during several High School-era engagements
Often paired with Blaze and Guardinous Rex for strike missions
members.notes: He’s at his best when the odds look bad and everyone else is tired.

members.name: Cody Cline
members.bio: Cody "Golden Prime" Cline manifests bright, focused energy that cuts through darkness—literally and symbolically.
history: Served as a front-line vanguard during multiple High School operations
Used his beacon flares to guide evacuees through blackouts
Often coordinated with Synergy and Harmony to stabilize team flow
members.notes: When he lights up, everyone else remembers why they’re still fighting.

members.name: Alyssa
members.bio: Alyssa is woven into the High School era’s memory as part of the wider circle of friends.
history: Present around many early Legionaires connections
Helped maintain a sense of normal life despite rising chaos
members.notes: Non-powered, but part of the emotional backbone of the group.

members.name: Justin Platt
abilities: Sound-based pulses that ricochet off terrain
members.bio: Justin "Echo Wood" Platt plays with sound and space, turning the battlefield into a resonant maze that favors his allies.
history: Used echo-mapping to guide allies through confusing or obstructed zones
Helped track threats that couldn’t be seen directly
In alternate branches of the multiverse, stands with Thunder Born—but here, he’s firmly Legionaires.
members.notes: His power feels subtle until you realize he’s been steering the whole fight.

members.name: Zack Dustin
abilities: Carves precise lines of force through space
members.bio: Zack "Carved Echo" Dustin specializes in sharp, surgical strikes that seem to come from impossible angles.
history: Often fights alongside Echo Wood, forming a paired "echo" combat style
Helped neutralize several agile threats with perfectly timed cuts
In Sam’s universe, he rides with Thunder Born—here, he stands as a Legionaire legend-in-the-making.
members.notes: He prefers efficient, clean wins over flashy ones.

members.name: Josh Clark
members.bio: Josh Clark is part of the extended High School network, more observer than combatant.
history: Connected to several core Legionaires through school and social circles
members.notes: Non-powered ally.

members.name: Jessica Fisher
abilities: Moisture control in the immediate area
members.bio: Jessica "Aquanora" Fisher is a fluid fighter who uses water as both shield and spear.
history: Provided battlefield control in rain, snow, and flood conditions
Worked well in tandem with Blaze and Golden Prime to balance elements
members.notes: Quiet, observant, and unexpectedly fierce when the fight hits the waterline.

members.name: Miles Robinson
members.bio: Miles Robinson is part of the wider High School web of connections.
history: Known primarily through shared classes and social overlap
members.notes: Non-powered, but part of the history.

members.name: Lizzy
members.bio: Lizzy is remembered as part of the social backdrop of the Legionaires’ school years.
members.notes: Non-powered.

members.name: Sam
members.bio: Sam appears in the High School lineup as part of the shared life history that later feeds into bigger stories.
members.notes: This entry reflects the High School-era connection rather than his later, darker paths.

members.name: Spencer
members.bio: Spencer is listed among the High School crew as part of the early, pre-hero chapters of the story.
members.notes: Non-powered in this context; Titan Spencer is represented separately in Titans data.

members.name: Dylan
members.bio: Dylan "Guardinous Rex" is a walking tank for the High School squad, built to hold the line when everyone else needs time to recover.
history: Served as a moving wall during several critical retreats
Often paired with Legend and Blaze to break enemy formations
members.notes: His style is simple: take the hit, stay standing, and dare the enemy to try again.

members.name: Kinnley Cline
abilities: Helps stabilize team morale and focus
members.bio: Kinnley "Harmony" Cline tunes the emotional and mental frequency of the battlefield, helping people fight as their best selves instead of their most scared.
history: Provided emotional grounding for multiple High School-era operations
Later married Alex Croft of the Spartans, tying two teams together through family
Often requested when missions risked high stress or internal conflict
members.notes: Her power and her relationship both literally and symbolically bridge different factions.

members.name: Sanford Duncan
members.bio: Sanford "Thunderbolt" Duncan brings fast-moving, high-voltage chaos to the field.
history: Used lightning bursts to intercept fast-moving threats
Helped power emergency systems during blackouts
members.notes: Excels in hit-and-run tactics.

members.name: Magic Matt
members.bio: "Magic Matt" blends stage magician flair with real battlefield misdirection, turning fights into mind games.
history: Ran interference by confusing enemy targeting and lines of sight
Helped cover retreats and stealth approaches with illusion screens
members.notes: Loves the theatrical side of hero work.

members.name: Kanyon
members.bio: Kanyon is part of the familiar faces of the High School era.
members.notes: Non-powered ally.

members.name: John
members.bio: John is one of the many classmates tied into the Legionaires’ past.
members.notes: Non-powered.

members.name: Quinton
members.bio: Quinton is noted as part of the extended High School circle.
members.notes: Non-powered.

members.name: Emery
members.bio: Emery is remembered as one of the casualties from Sam’s corrupted return.
history: Killed during the events known as The Return
members.notes: Listed among the fallen High School friends.

members.name: Mason
members.bio: Mason appears here not as a fighter, but as one of the friends lost in the crossfire of greater events.
history: Killed during the events surrounding Sam’s corrupted return
members.notes: One of several names permanently marked as fallen.

members.name: Xavier
members.bio: Xavier’s name is carried forward as part of the cost of The Return.
history: Killed by fallout of Sam’s corrupted actions
members.notes: Remembered, even if not powered.

members.name: Josh Davis
members.bio: Josh Davis is another name on the list of those lost when Sam returned corrupted.
history: Killed in the wave of violence associated with The Return
members.notes: Marked as fallen in Legionaires records.

members.name: Teagan
members.bio: Teagan is memorialized as one of the High School-era casualties tied to Sam’s darker chapter.
history: Died during the same series of events that claimed multiple classmates
members.notes: Part of the emotional weight carried by surviving Legionaires.

members.name: Carter
members.bio: Carter’s record is short but important: another life ended during The Return.
history: Counted among those slain as Sam’s corruption unfolded
members.notes: His name is kept in the High School register as a reminder.

members.name: Nate Anderson
members.bio: Nate Anderson’s inclusion marks yet another casualty from a time when the cost of heroism was paid by many who never chose the fight.
history: Died during the events attributed to Sam’s corrupted return to Earth
members.notes: Recorded among the fallen High School friends.

members.name: Paxton
members.bio: Paxton is part of the early social circle tied to the Junior High years.
members.notes: Non-powered ally.

members.name: Spencer Hill
members.bio: Spencer Hill was part of the early Legionaires environment during foundational years.
members.notes: Non-powered.

members.name: Cassidy Cline
members.bio: Cassidy "Protector" Cline was one of the first Junior High members to demonstrate defensive-focused heroic traits.
history: Often took charge of protecting younger or weaker classmates
First displayed ability during a school emergency drill gone wrong
members.notes: A naturally protective presence in the group.

members.name: Adam Leger
members.bio: Adam Leger was part of the broader Junior High friend network.
members.notes: Non-powered ally.

members.name: Sam Phillips
members.bio: Sam Phillips was a steady presence during the Junior High era.
members.notes: Non-powered ally.

members.name: Will Knight
members.bio: Will "Eagle Master" Knight brought early aerodynamic talent to the Legionaires’ Junior High roster.
history: Known for spotting threats before anyone else noticed them
Often acted as lookout during group outings and early missions
members.notes: His early scouting instincts foreshadow later frontline heroes.

members.name: Hayden Perks
members.bio: Hayden Perks was part of the extended Junior High group.
members.notes: Non-powered ally.

members.name: Cienna
members.bio: Cienna was part of the shared Junior High experience with the early Legionaires circle.
members.notes: Non-powered.

members.name: Clayton
members.bio: Clayton was part of the Junior High cohort tied to early friendships.
members.notes: Non-powered ally.

members.name: Bridget
members.bio: Bridget appears as part of the early-phase social circle.
members.notes: Non-powered.

members.name: Ryan
members.bio: Ryan was involved primarily as part of group camaraderie during Junior High.
members.notes: Non-powered.

members.name: Carson
members.bio: Carson is listed as part of the Junior High-era group ties.
members.notes: Non-powered ally.

members.name: Sydney
members.bio: Sydney was part of the same early environment from which many Legionaires bonds formed.
members.notes: Non-powered.

members.name: Natalie
members.bio: Natalie is listed among the Junior High friend group.
members.notes: Non-powered.

members.name: Carter Olsen
members.bio: Carter Olsen is listed among the Junior High-era fallen during Sam’s corrupted return.
history: Killed during the events known as The Return
members.notes: Memorialized in Legionaires records.

members.name: Steven
members.bio: Steven is listed among the casualties connected to Sam’s corrupted return.
history: Killed during the fallout of The Return
members.notes: Remembered among Junior High fallen.

members.name: Kaden Hansen
members.bio: Kaden Hansen is listed as one of the Junior High-era casualties.
history: Killed during the same period as other fallen Legionaires allies
members.notes: One of the several marked lost during The Return.

members.name: Olivia
members.bio: Olivia is remembered as part of the lives touched and lost during Sam’s corrupted return.
history: Killed during the events surrounding The Return
members.notes: Listed among the fallen Junior High group.

members.name: Quincy
members.bio: Quincy is listed among the Junior High names permanently marked as fallen.
history: Died during fallout from Sam’s corrupted return
members.notes: Recorded in the fallen registry.

members.name: Jackson
members.bio: Listed as optional entry from the Maybe Add list.

members.name: Sami
members.bio: Listed as optional entry.

members.name: Josh Noble
members.bio: Josh "Golden Caster" Noble grew up slinging spells in the schoolyard before he ever knew what the Legionaires were. His golden energy is versatile—part shield, part artillery, part flashlight in the dark.
members.notes: Often imagined as the "mage" of the Elementary squad.

members.name: Matt Lihpia
members.bio: Matt brings stubborn resilience and quiet loyalty. He’s the kid who never leaves anyone behind on the playground or the battlefield.

members.name: Jose Rodriguez
members.bio: Jose has always been fast—mentally and physically. He naturally slips into point position when the group is exploring new territory.

members.name: Jorge
members.bio: Jorge is the glue friend—solid at everything, great at vibes, and always in the middle of the group photo.

members.name: Tayton Baker
members.bio: Tayton is the sprint-then-laugh type, perfect for relaying info or distracting something bigger than him.

members.name: Michael
members.bio: Michael isn’t always the loudest, but when he commits to something, everyone feels it.

members.name: Thomas
members.bio: Thomas "Mr. Dibs" always calls his shot first—seats, roles, dares. That instinct to claim responsibility early is what makes him a natural tactician.
members.notes: Nickname sticks in both real life and in-universe.

members.name: Veronica Teaford
members.bio: Veronica anchors the emotional tone of the group and makes sure nobody feels like the odd one out.

members.name: Erica Teaford
members.bio: Erica tends to notice patterns before anyone else, quietly nudging the group away from trouble—or into better opportunities.

members.name: Nate Greene
members.bio: Nate is that steady background presence who always shows up when it actually matters.

members.name: Ivan Aparicio
members.bio: Ivan is curious about how everything works, from gadgets to group dynamics.

members.name: Abby
members.bio: Abby "The Ghost" is quiet enough to vanish into the edges of a room, but she misses nothing.
members.notes: Her codename reflects how she tends to slip in and out of situations unnoticed.

members.name: Lupa
members.bio: Lupa brings chaotic good energy wherever they go, shaking up routines and expectations.

members.name: Shanna
members.bio: Shanna is reliable, warm, and often the first to try to cheer someone up.

members.name: Elizabeth
members.bio: Elizabeth tends to hang back, observe, and then land the one question that reframes the whole situation.

members.name: Noah
members.bio: Noah has the natural instincts of someone who’s always ready to defend his friends first and think about it later.

members.name: Elise
members.bio: Elise is tuned into how people feel and often steps in as mediator.

members.name: Brigdan
members.bio: Brigdan brings raw force and stubborn courage, especially when the odds look bad.

members.name: Addie
members.bio: Addie is pure heart and loyalty, the kind of friend who makes the Legionaires feel like a family.

members.name: Kaden Hansen
members.bio: One of the kids lost during Sam’s corrupted Return. His memory is part of why the Legionaires take the Maw so seriously.
members.notes: Fallen by Sam’s hand.

members.name: Nick
members.bio: Nick’s loss still echoes in the group’s shared history.
members.notes: Fallen by Sam’s hand.

members.name: Jose Chovez
members.bio: Jose Chovez was part of the early circle of friends before the Maw took everything sideways.
members.notes: Fallen by Sam’s hand.

members.name: Bridger
members.bio: Bridger is remembered for his energy and willingness to jump into anything with the group.
members.notes: Fallen by Sam’s hand.

members.name: Dustin Khong
members.bio: Dustin Khong’s memory lives on in the Legionaires’ stories of early days and shared chaos.
members.notes: Fallen by Sam’s hand.

members.name: Kason
members.bio: One of the two Kasons remembered in the Legionaires’ rolls, both taken too early.
members.notes: Fallen by Sam’s hand.

members.name: Kody
members.bio: Kody is remembered as a chaotic, fun presence in the group.
members.notes: Fallen by Sam’s hand.

members.name: Kason
members.bio: A second Kason listed among the fallen, his name kept to honor both kids who shared it.
members.notes: Fallen by Sam’s hand.

members.name: Kaia
members.bio: Kaia’s loss is one of the quieter scars on the team’s history.
members.notes: Fallen by Sam’s hand.

members.name: Gabe
members.bio: Gabe is remembered as quick to laugh and quick to defend his friends.
members.notes: Fallen by Sam’s hand.

members.name: Raven
members.bio: Raven’s name is often spoken quietly when the Legionaires talk about what the Maw cost them.
members.notes: Fallen by Sam’s hand.

members.name: Grace
members.bio: Grace embodied exactly what her name suggests—kindness and calm, even in chaos.
members.notes: Fallen by Sam’s hand.

members.name: Kalie
members.bio: Kalie is remembered in flashes of laughter and shared memories.
members.notes: Fallen by Sam’s hand.

members.name: Mikeal
members.bio: Mikeal’s name sits on the Legionaires’ fallen rolls as another reminder of what went wrong during The Return.
members.notes: Fallen by Sam’s hand.

members.name: Sierra
members.bio: Sierra’s memory sticks with the team in small, everyday details they still notice.
members.notes: Fallen by Sam’s hand.

members.name: Jocelyn
members.bio: One of two Jocelyns on the list, her name is carried with the same care as the others.
members.notes: Fallen by Sam’s hand.

members.name: Jocelyn
members.bio: A second Jocelyn recorded among the fallen, emphasizing how tangled and personal the losses became.
members.notes: Fallen by Sam’s hand.

members.name: Jack Smith
abilities: Instinctive defense reaction to sudden threats
Good at holding lines and defending positions
Above-average durability and reaction timing under pressure
members.bio: Jack "Sentinel" Smith wasn’t a core friend group member, but when crises hit, he always seemed to end up standing guard at the edges. Calm under pressure and naturally protective, he became a reliable reinforcement whenever the Legionaires needed another set of steady hands.
history: Frequently positioned himself on the perimeter during early disturbances
Helped guide less-experienced kids out of danger zones
Developed a reputation for staying level-headed even when others panicked
members.notes: Not the loudest or the flashiest, but extremely dependable — the classic watcher on the wall.

members.name: Dustin Edmonds
abilities: Uses wingpack jumps/glides for short aerial bursts
members.bio: Dustin "Falcon" Edmonds drifted in and out of the friend circles but always carried a sharp observational instinct. When things got messy, he naturally took the high ground — rooftops, ladders, playground structures — giving the Legionaires early warning and quick recon support.
history: Accidentally became the group’s first real recon scout
Often spotted danger before it reached the others
Participated in several early evacuations by guiding kids to safer paths
members.notes: Moves best when he has height or momentum — his instincts are tuned for aerial maps rather than ground-level chaos.
